value.title: DAX Fridays! #143: ADDCOLUMNS and SUMMARIZE | Create virtual tables

value.title: DAX Fridays! #17: DATEDIFF
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to calculate the difference between two dates using DATEDIFF. I also show you how to overcome the issue when the start date is larger than the end date. value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
